definition: variant of 卷心菜[juan3 xin1 cai4]
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Mother often makes dumpling filling with cabbage.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈常用卷心菜做饺子馅。

sentences.english: Cut the cabbage into fine long shreds.
sentences.chinese: 将卷心菜切成又细又长的丝。

sentences.english: Brazilian palm of genus euterpe whose buds are eaten like cabbage when young.
sentences.chinese: 巴西棕榈科植物叶芽如卷心菜嫩时可食。

sentences.english: Woman: I've ordered savory pork and coleslaw.
sentences.chinese: 我叫的是美味猪肉和凉拌卷心菜。

sentences.english: But don't overcook cabbage, as only uncooked cabbage can do you good.
sentences.chinese: 不过，不要长时间烹调卷心菜，生吃才有防癌功效。

sentences.english: Cruciferous vegetables are those in the mustard or cabbage family, and the list is exhaustive. Unfortunately, most U.
sentences.chinese: 十字花科蔬菜是芥菜或卷心菜家族的所有成员。

sentences.english: Eg. We are little piggies , we like eating cabbage.
sentences.chinese: 我们是小猪，我们喜欢吃卷心菜。

sentences.english: Pre-prepared or stored salads, including coleslaw.
sentences.chinese: 前的准备或储存的沙拉，包括凉拌卷心菜。

sentences.english: Cabbage leaves can be steamed or cooked in a small amount of boiling water until they soften.
sentences.chinese: 卷心菜叶子可以放在少量的沸水中蒸或煮直到变软。

sentences.english: Poached sea bass fillet with German wine, potatoes, cabbage.
sentences.chinese: 水煮海鲈鱼配德国白葡萄酒，土豆，卷心菜。
在德国它指的是“酸卷心菜”。

sentences.english: When you've boiled the cabbage, strain off the water through a colander.
sentences.chinese: 当你把卷心菜煮开后，用漏勺把水滤掉。
兔子，你快把我们家的卷心菜吃光了。
